description.narrative:
Empowerment, political participation of women and female leadership in the context of Conflict Transformation project, falls under The Future Starts Now initiative funded by Oxfam Novib. This Project will be implemented in partnership with Elman Peace and HumanRights Centre (EPHRC) and Somali Women Studies Centre (SWSC) in Mogadishu. The projects aim to empower both women and young women leaders in south central Somalia as forward planning for the 2016 Elections. It will work with 'wise women' leaders who will engage with the traditional structures to advocate for women participation and representation.
Elman Peace <(>&<)> Human Rights Centre is aNon-profit making, Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) which was established in 1991 in Mogadishu, Somalia. The founder of EPHRC was Mohamoud Ali Ahmed, commonly known as Mr. Elman. Elman was one of the pioneers in human rights activism in Somalia and is also known as the #Father of Peace# due to his campaigns against the war. His vision was based on his famous slogan #Drop the Gun and Pick up the Pen#; which was centered on alleviating poverty and promoting human rights for all Somali people; this was after the outbreak of civil war in 1991. For his campaign against the armed conflict, Elman was assassinated on March 9th 1996. From its infancy, EPHRChas grown both in policy, areas of intervention and activities. Since commencement, EPHRC has undertaken a wide spectrum of projects ranging from purely humanitarian and life saving interventions to developmental projects. EPHRC is very well renowned for its success rate and track record in Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration (DDR) projects for children involved in the armed conflict, and also strong focuses on human rights monitoring and reporting; EPHRC also prioritizes providing alternative livelihoods for vulnerable members of society, education, protection, response and prevention of gender based violence and activities for improving and sustaining gender justice and empowerment. EPHRC has spread to five regions in South and Central Somalia. It has a sub-office in Dusamareeb (Galgaduud) and field staff in Guriel, Abudwak, Beladweyne, Bay, Lower and Middle Shabelle and Afgoey corridor.

participating-org.narrative:
Elman Peace and Human Rights Center (EPHRC) is a Non-profit making, Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) which was established in 1991 in Mogadishu, Somalia. The founder of EPHRC was Mohamoud Ali Ahmed, commonly known as Mr. Elman. Elman was one of the pioneers inhuman rights activism in Somalia and is also known as the #Father of Peace# due to his campaigns against the war. His vision was based on his famous slogan #Drop the Gun and Pick up the Pen#; which was centered on alleviating poverty and promoting human rights for all Somali people; this was after the outbreak of civil war in 1991. For his campaign against the armed conflict, Elman was assassinated on March 9th 1996.
From its infancy, EPHRC has grown both in policy, areas of intervention and activities. Among policies that have been developed are an equal opportunity policy, a code of ethics, a whistleblowers policy, financial management policy, governance structure, sustainability manual and a human resource protocol manual. The organization#s Board of Directors (BOD) acts as the highest governing organ in its management. The board is made up of persons of high reputation, various professional backgrounds, whom liaise with and oversee all functions of the organization on voluntary basis. Thecurrent Board is made up of seven members of whom 2 are women as part of EPHRC#s gender mainstreaming. The Executive Committee oversees the day-to-day activities of the organization and serves as the direct intermediary between the functional staff and the BOD. Fartun Abdisalaan Adan is currently the executive director of EPHRC. By policy, EPHRC is an equal opportunity employer and no less than 40% of any gender may be employed. Currently65% of EPHRC office staff is female while 40% of the field staff based in the five regions where EPHRC works are female.
Since commencement, EPHRC has undertaken a wide spectrum of projects ranging from purely humanitarian and life saving interventions to developmental projects. EPHRC is very well renowned for its success rate and track record in Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration(DDR) projects for children involved in the armed conflict, and also strong focuses on human rights monitoring and reporting; EPHRCalso prioritizes providing alternative livelihoods for vulnerable members of society, education, protection, response and prevention of gender based violence and activities for improving and sustaining gender justice and empowerment.
EPHRC has spread to five regions in South and Central Somalia. It has a sub-office in Dusamareeb (Galgaduud) and field staff in Guriel, Abudwak, Beladweyne, Bay, Lower and Middle Shabelle and Afgoey corridor.
Elman Peace and Human Rights Center
